text: وان يروا۟ ءاية يعرضوا۟ ويقولوا۟ سحر مستمر

translations.translation: If they see a Sign they turn away, saying There is no end to this witchcraft!'
But if they see a sign they turn away, and say: "This is the same old lie continuing,"
(Regardless of any Signs these people see), they turn away and say: “This is an ongoing sorcery.”
Whenever they see a miracle, they turn away from it and say, "This is just a powerful magic".
And when they see a sign, they turn away and say, “Just a customary magic!”
And if they see an Ayah, they turn away and say: "This is magic, Mustamir."
And if they see a miracle they turn aside and say: Transient magic.
Yet if they see a sign they turn away, and they say 'A continuous sorcery!'
And if they behold a portent they turn away and say: Prolonged illusion.
Yet, when they see a sign they [who deny the truth] turn their backs and say, "The same old sorcery!"
And if they behold a sign, they turn away and say: "magic continous"
If they see a sign, they turn away, and say, ‘An incessant magic!’
But if they see a Sign, they turn away, and say, "This is (but) transient magic."
And if they see a sign, they turn away, and say: "This is continuous magic."
Yet if they see a sign (the unbelievers) turn their backs and say: 'This is but a continuation of sorcery'
Yet whenever they see a miracle, they turn away, and say, “Continuous magic.”
And if they see a miracle, they turn away and say, "Passing magic."

[54:2] And if they, the disbelievers among Quraysh, see a sign, a miracle of the Prophet (s), they turn away and say, this is: ‘A powerful sorcery!’ (mustamirr, ‘powerful’, derives from al-mirra, meaning ‘strength’; or it [mustamirr] means ‘incessant’).
(And if they behold a portent) like the splitting of the moon (they turn away) they deny the sign (and say:) this sign is nothing but (Prolonged illusion) which will vanish.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
ومقتضيات أوهامهم وخيالاتهم { وَيَقُولُواْ } من شدة إنكارهم وعنادهم: هذا الذي صدر منه على خلاف العادة { سِحْرٌ مُّسْتَمِرٌّ } [القمر: 2] في الزمان
 وقوعه لا مختلق منه فقط

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
{ وإِن يَرَوا } أي: أهل مكة { آيةً } تدل على صدق رسوله صلى الله عليه وسلم { يُعرضوا } عن الإيمان { ويقولوا سِحْرٌ مستمر } محكم شديدٌ قويّ، من: المِرّة، وهي القوة، أو: دائم مطّرد
 رُوي: أنه لما انشق قالوا: هذا سحر ابن أبي كبشة؟ فسلوا السُّفار، فلما قَدِموا سألوهم، فقالوا: إنهم قد رأيته، فقالوا: قد استمر سحره في البلاد، فنزلت
 قال البيضاوي: دلّ قوله: { مستمر } على أنهم رأوا قبله آيات أخرى مترادفة، ومعجزات سابقة
 هـ
 أو: مستمر، ذاهب ومارٌّ، يزول ولا يبقى، من: مرّ الشيء واستمر: ذهب
